value.name: Life without parole is a 'slower' death sentence. Are legal defense systems measuring up?
value.description: Almost 56,000 people are serving sentences that will keep them locked up until they die, but most states don’t have minimum qualifications for their lawyers.

value.name: Raleigh and Durham police hire for new leaders | Raleigh News & Observer
value.description: Now is the time to reimagine and hire someone who will reinvent your police department,” says Chris Burbank of the Center for Policing Equity. Community members will have a chance to weigh in soon.

value.name: Man killed in Durham shooting was son of retired deputy police chief
value.description: "I know the entire police department has been shocked by this," said Larry Smith, a retired deputy chief who worked with Marsh and now is spokesman for the Durham Fraternal Order of Police.
